name: src/components/DataBoundScrollView.js
DataBoundScrollView
description: A FlexScrollView with enhanced functionality for maintaining a two-way connection with a PrioritisedArray.

name: constructor
description:
Be sure to specify either a getSize function in the class of the itemTemplate, or to specify the size in the
layoutOptions.

params.name: options
params.description:
The options passed inherit from previous classes. Avoid using the dataSource option since
the DataBoundScrollView creates its own dataSource from options.dataStore.

params.name: options.dataStore
params.description: The data that should be read to create entries.

params.name: options.dataStores
params.description: Instead of passing one dataStore, this option can be used to pass multiple

params.name: options.itemTemplate
params.description: A function that returns a renderable representing each data item.

params.name: options.placeholderTemplate
params.description:
A function that returns a renderable to display when there are
no items present.

params.name: options.headerTemplate
params.description: A function that returns a renderable to display as a header.

params.name: options.orderBy
params.description:
An ordering function that takes two data models (model1, model2).
If it returns true, then model1 should go before model2.

params.name: options.groupBy
params.description:
A function that takes a model and returns a value to group by. If set, then
the groupTemplate option also needs to be set.

params.name: options.groupTemplate
params.description:
A function that takes as a single argument, the groupBy value, and returns
a renderable to insert before a group belonging to that value.

params.name: options.dataFilter
params.description:
Filter what data is relevant to the view. Should be a function taking as
an argument a model and from there returning a boolean.

params.name: options.stickHeaders
params.description:
If set to true, then the group headers will stick to the top when scrolling.
Beware that this is slightly buggy as of now and might require some fine tuning to provide a better UX.

params.name: options.customInsertSpec
params.description:
A function that takes as a single argument a model and returns a spec
that is used when inserting a new item.

params.name: options.chatScrolling
params.description:
If set to true, the scroll will remain at the bottom if at bottom already
when new messages are added.

If this function returns true, then model1 will be placed before model2.

name: getRenderableFromID
description: Gets a renderable from a specific ID

params.name: id
params.description: The id of data

params.name: dataStoreIndex
params.description: the index of the dataStore that is used, if several of them are specified

name: setItemTemplate
description: Set a template function, optionally re-renders all the dataSource' renderables

name: setGroupTemplate
description: Sets a group template function, optionally re-renders all the dataSource' renderables.

name: setDataStore
description:
Sets the dataStore to use. This will repopulate the view and remove any (if present) old items.
We decorate it with debounce in order to (naively) avoid race conditions when setting the dataStore frequently after each other

name: setDataStores
description: Sets the multiple dataStores to use. The "multiple" version of setDataStore(dataStore).

name: getDataStore
description: Gets the currently set dataStore.

name: getDataStores
description: Gets the currently set dataStore.

name: reloadFilter
description:
Reloads the dataFilter option of the DataBoundScrollView, and verifies whether the items in the dataStore are allowed by the new filter.
It removes any currently visible items that aren't allowed anymore, and adds any non-visible ones that are allowed now.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} Resolves when filter has been applied

params.name: newFilter
params.description: New filter function to verify item visibility with.

return.description: Resolves when filter has been applied

name: clearDataStore
description: Clears the dataSource by removing all entries

name: isAtBottom
description: Determines whether the last element showing is the actual last element

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} True if the last element showing is the actual last element

return.description: True if the last element showing is the actual last element

name: getGroups
description: Returns the currently active group elements, or an empty object of none are present.

params.name: dataStoreIndex
params.description: The index of the data store that is being modified

name: getSize
description: Based on the guess that layout is ListLayout, calculates the vertical size

name: src/components/Dialog.js
Dialog
description: Abstract class to recognize a dialog in the controller

params.name: goBackInHistory
params.description: If set to true, goes back in history

name: src/components/ReflowingScrollView.js
ReflowingScrollView
description:
Class extended by the dataBoundScrollView and for wrapping up a View.
It automatically listens for reflows and handles them accordingly

name: constructor
description: Constructor does not add any new options.

name: src/components/logic/branding/BrandingEngine.js
setOptionsFromDataSource
description:
Sets the branding options using the local cache and an external dataSource.
If a cached version is present, it is used to populate the options, and the function is resolved immediately.
Otherwise, the options are populated from the external dataSource.
In both cases, the latest options are fetched from the dataSource and saved to cache for use on the next app launch.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} A promise that is resolved when the branding options have been fetched from cache or remote storage.

return.description: A promise that is resolved when the branding options have been fetched from cache or remote storage.

name: setOptions
description: Set the branding options manually.

params.name: options
params.description: Dictionary object with wanted branding options. Example: {textColor: 'black', backgroundColor: 'white'}

name: setOption
description: Set one branding option manually.

params.name: optionName
params.description: Name of the option to fetch.

params.name: value
params.description: Value to set the option to.

name: get
description: Get a branding option value by its name.

params.name: optionName
params.description: Name of the option to fetch.

name: getAll
description: Gets all branding options for the current brand.

name: src/components/logic/branding/BrandingEngineSingleton.js
getInstance
description: Get a singleton global instance of the BrandingEngine.

name: src/core/App.js
App
description:
The App class exposes the Router which can be used to configure the Application's routing settings.
You can specify which Route should be default by calling `router.setDefault(controller, method);`

name: constructor
description: Have the router check check which route is active and fire the Controller

params.name: router
params.description: The router instance to use in the app.

params.name: context
params.description: The data context instance to use in the app.

name: dialogManager
description: The dialog manager used to show and hide dialogs

name: router
description: The router of the application

name: context
description: The animationController that controls the animations between screens

name: start
description: Triggers a creation of the app, by using an Injection.get

name: src/core/Controller.js
Controller
description:
The Controller class provides the highest level of control regarding the application features. Within the Controller context
each method will registered to receive calls from the Routing engine. With direct access to the Famo.us Context, every method can
control the creation of Views and Transitions.

name: constructor
description: Saves the router and context to this.router and this.context, respectively.

params.name: router
params.description: Injected globally used router

params.name: context
params.description: Injected animationController used by the app

params.name: dialogManager
params.description: The dialog manager that shows and hides dialogs

name: router
description: The router used globally in the app

name: context
description: The AnimationController used globally in the app to change screens

name: dialogManager
description: The dialogmanager used to show and hide dialogs. If a controller returns a Dialog, this will be used

name: onLeave
description: Called to notify the Controller that the route is changed

name: onRouteCalled
description:
Called by the Router when this controller instance is being navigated to. Calls the controller's method in the given route,
and triggers a famous-flex AnimationController show() with the View instance that the method returns. Is also capable of receiving
a Promise from the method, in which case the show() is called after the promise is resolved.

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} success Whether the controller method was fully executed, and the Router should emit a routechange event.

params.name: route
params.description: Route object generated by the Router. Contains a method name to call, and a render spec for passing to the AnimationController.

return.description: success Whether the controller method was fully executed, and the Router should emit a routechange event.

name: _showView
description: Shows a view that was returned from a child controller

name: src/core/Model.js
Model
description: A model that has attributes synced with the database.

name: constructor
description: Creates a new instance of a model.

params.name: id
params.description:
Optional: The identifier for this model. For a user model this might be a user ID, for example. It
          is used to build the path to the dataSource. This path is <root>/<model name appended with 's'>/<id>.
          If no id is given, a randomly generated one will be pushed to the dataSource. You can use this for
          creating new objects in the dataSource.

params.name: data
params.description:
Optional: The initial data to fill the model with. The model will be extended with any
                     properties present in the data parameter.

params.name: options
params.description:
Optional: Additional options. Currently used is "dataSnapshot", which if present is used
                         to fetch the initial model data. If not present, the model will add a one-time
                         subscription to the dataSource to fetch initial data.

name: synced
description: Check if the model has been synchonized with the database

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} Resolves when the model has been synchonized with the database

return.description: Resolves when the model has been synchonized with the database

name: replaceProperties
description: Updates properties of this model to the values of those of another model, or a normal JS Object.

params.name: newModelOrData
params.description: Data to replace old data with

name: _replaceModelAccessorsWithDatabinding
description: Replaces all getters/setters defined on the model implementation with properties that trigger update events to the dataSource.

name: _writeLocalDataToModel
description:
Writes data, if present, to the Model's dataSource. Uses a transaction, meaning that only one update is triggered to the dataSource,
even though multiple fields change.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} Resolves when the transaction is complete and synced

params.name: data
params.description: Data to write, can be null.

return.description: Resolves when the transaction is complete and synced

name: src/core/Router.js
Router
description: Abstract Router class which can be implemented to be used in an MVP setup.

name: setDefault
description: Sets the initial controller and method to be activated whenever the controllers are activated.

params.name: controller
params.description: Default controller instance, controller constructor, or controller name to go to.

params.name: method
params.description: Default method to call in given controller.

name: setControllerSpecs
description: Sets the animation specs object for use by the famous-flex AnimationController.

params.name: specs
params.description: Animation specs, keyed by target controller.

name: go
description: Triggers navigation to one of the controllers

params.name: controller
params.description: The controller instance, controller constructor, or controller name to go to.

params.name: method
params.description: The method to call in given controller.

params.name: params
params.description: Dictonary of key-value pairs containing named arguments (i.e. {id: 1, test: "yes"})

name: getRoute
description: Returns an object containing the current route.

name: add
description: Registers a single controller.

params.name: route
params.description: Route to trigger handler on.

params.name: handler.enter
params.description: Method to call on entering a route.

params.name: handler.leave
params.description: Method to call on when leaving a route.

name: run
description: On a route change, calls the corresponding controller method with the given parameter values.

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} Whether the current route was successfully ran.

return.description: Whether the current route was successfully ran.

name: getPreviousRoute
description: Return the previous known route, or default route if no route stack is present

name: _executeRoute
description: Executes the controller handler associated with a given route, passing the route as a parameter.

params.name: rule
params.description: Rule handler to execute.

params.name: route
params.description: Route object to pass as parameter.

name: _setHistory
description:
Checks if the current route is already present in the history stack, and if so removes all entries after
and including the first occurrence. It will then append the current route to the history stack.

params.name: currentRoute
params.description: Route object containing url, controller, method, keys, and values.

name: _hasVisited
description: CheckS whether a route is already present in the history stack.

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} Whether the route has been visited previously.

params.name: currentRoute
params.description: Route object containing url, controller, method, keys, and values.

return.description: Whether the route has been visited previously.

name: _getAnimationSpec
description:
Returns the Famous-Flex animation spec for two given routes. Takes its spec inputs from the specs set in
router.setControllerSpecs(), which is called from the app constructor.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} A spec object if one is found, or an empty object otherwise.

params.name: previousRoute
params.description: Previous route object containing url, controller, method, keys, and values.

params.name: currentRoute
params.description: Current route object containing url, controller, method, keys, and values.

return.description: A spec object if one is found, or an empty object otherwise.

name: _getControllerName
description:
Extracts a controller name from a given string, constructor, or controller instance. 'Controller' part is not included in the returned name.
E.g. _getControllerName(HomeController) -> 'Home'.

params.name: controller
params.description: String, constructor, or controller instance.

name: src/core/View.js
View
description:
An Arva View. Can be constructed explicitly by using new View() but is more commonly used as a base class for
views used by the app.

name: constructor

params.name: options.
params.description:
The options passed to the view will be stored in this.options, but won't change any
behaviour of the core functionality of the view. Instead, configuration of the View is done by decorators.

name: build
description: Deprecated, it is no longer required to call build() from within your View instances.

name: reflowRecursively
description: Reflows the layout while also informing any subscribing parents that a reflow has to take place

name: getResolvedSize
description: Gets the size used when displaying a renderable on the screen the last tick

params.name: renderableOrName
params.description: The renderable or the name of the renderable of which you need the size

name: containsUncalculatedSurfaces
description: Returns true if the view contains uncalculated surfaces

name: addRenderable
description: Adds a renderable to the layout.

params.name: renderable
params.description: The renderable to be added

params.name: Decorator
params.description: Any decorator(s) to apply to the renderable

name: removeRenderable
description: Removes the renderable from the view

name: prioritiseDockBefore
description:
Rearranges the order in which docked renderables are parsed for rendering, ensuring that 'renderableName' is processed
before 'nextRenderableName'.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} when the renderable has finished its animation

params.name: show.
params.description: Whether to show or not

return.description: when the renderable has finished its animation

name: decorateRenderable
description: Decorates a renderable with other decorators. Using the same decorators as used previously will override the old ones.
examples: this.decorateRenderable('myRenderable',layout.size(100, 100));

name: setRenderableFlowState
description: Sets a renderable flow state as declared in the @flow.stateStep, or @flow.defaultState

params.name: renderable.
params.description: The name of the renderable

params.name: stateName.
params.description: The name of the state as declared in the first argument of the decorator

name: setViewFlowState
description: Sets a view flow state as declared in the @flow.viewState

params.name: stateName.
params.description: The name of the state as declared in the first argument of the decorator

name: getRenderableFlowState
description: Gets the name of a flow state of a renderable.

unknown.tagValue: {String} stateName the name of the state that the renderable is in

return.description: stateName the name of the state that the renderable is in

name: getViewFlowState
description: Gets the name of the flow state of a view.

unknown.tagValue: {String} stateName the name of the state that this view is in.

return.description: stateName the name of the state that this view is in.

name: replaceRenderable
description: Replaces an existing decorated renderable with a new renderable, preserving all necessary state and decorations

params.name: oldRenderable.
params.description: The name of the renderable

params.name: newRenderable
params.description: Renderable to replace the old renderable with

name: getScrollView
description: Gets the scroll view that was set if @layout.scrollable was used on the view

name: with
description: Binds the options passed to the specific view class

name: getSize
description:
getSize() is called by this view and by layoutControllers. For lazy people that don't want to specifiy their own getSize() function,
we provide a fallback. This function can be performance expensive when using non-docked renderables, but for docked renderables it
is efficient and convenient]

name: hideRenderable
description: Hides a renderable that has been declared with @layout.animate

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} when the renderable has finished its animation

return.description: when the renderable has finished its animation

name: onNewSize
description: Passes a callback that gets called every time the context size changes.

params.name: callback
params.description: a callback with arguments (width, height)

name: onceNewSize
description:
Gets a (new) context size of the view. This will always happen at least once immediately after the view is constructed.
Hence, it can safely be used in the constructor to get the (initial) size of the view.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} Resolves when there's a new size

return.description: Resolves when there's a new size

name: repeatFlowState
description: Repeat a certain flowState indefinitely

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} resolves to false if the flow state can't be repeated due to an existing running repeat

params.name: persistent.
params.description:
If true, then it will keep on repeating until explicitly cancelled by cancelRepeatFlowState.
If false, it will be interrupted automatically by any interrput to another state. Defaults to true

return.description: resolves to false if the flow state can't be repeated due to an existing running repeat

name: cancelRepeatFlowState
description: Cancel a repeating renderable. This will cancel the animation for next flow-cycle, it won't interject the current animation cycle.

name: setDefaultState
description: Initiate a renderable to a default flow state.

name: _initUtils
description: Inits the utils that are used as helper classes for the view

name: _requestLayoutControllerReflow
description: Requests for a parent LayoutController trying to resolve the size of this view

name: _constructDecoratedRenderables
description: Construct all the renderables that have been decorated in the class.

name: _assignRenderable
description: Assigns a renderable to this view, without setting this[renderableName]

params.name: renderable
params.description: the renderable that is going to be added

params.name: renderableName
params.description: the name of the renderable

name: _createLayoutController
description: Combines all layouts defined in subclasses of the View into a single layout for the LayoutController.

name: _callLegacyLayoutFunctions
description: Layout all renderables that have explicit context.set() calls in this View's legacy layout array.

name: _prepareLayoutController
description:
Either adds this.layout (a LayoutController) to the current View, or a FlexScrollView containing this.layout if this view
has been decorated with a @scrollable.

name: _getLayoutSize
description:
Calculates the total height of the View's layout when it's embedded inside a FlexScrollView (i.e. @scrollable is set on the View),
by iterating over each renderable inside the View, and finding the minimum and maximum y values at which they are drawn.

name: _name
description: Retrieves the class name of the subclass View instance.

name: _copyPrototypeProperties
description: Copies prototype properties set by decorators to this

name: _initOwnDecorations
description: Inits the decorations that is set on a class level

name: _optionObserver
description: A copy of the options that were passed in the constructor

name: _realRenderables
description: The renderables "outputted" by the view that are passed to the underlying famous-flex layer

name: layouts
deprecated:
`
The old way of setting the spec of the renderables created by adding renderables through
`this.renderables.myRenderable = ....

name: _bindToSelf
description: Binds the method to this view. Used by the util DecoratedRenderables

params.name: method
params.description: The method that is about to be bound

name: _setPipeToSelf
description: Pipes a renderable to this view. Used by the util DecoratedRenderables

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} true if piping was successful, otherwise false

params.name: method
params.description: The method that is about to be bound

params.name: enable
params.description: set to false to unpipe

return.description: true if piping was successful, otherwise false

name: _setupRenderable
description: Sets up a renderable when it is invalidated to be re-rendered (happens on creation too)

name: src/data/DataSource.js
DataSource
description: @author: Tom Clement (tjclement)

params.name: path
params.description: Full path to resource in remote data storage.

name: inheritable
description:
Indicate that the DataSource can be inherited when instantiating a list of models. By
default we indicate false, which should trigger data model instantiation to create unique
DataSource references to each model either in array or directly.

If set to false, model updates trigger creation of a new DataSource instance. (default)

name: toString
description: Returns the full path to this dataSource's source on the remote storage provider.

name: child
description: Returns a dataSource reference to the given child branch of the current dataSource.

unknown.tagValue: {DataSource} New dataSource instance pointing to the given child branch.

params.name: childName
params.description: Child branch name.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional: additional options to pass to new DataSource instance.

return.description: New dataSource instance pointing to the given child branch.

name: path
description: Returns the full URL to the path on the dataSource. Functionally identical to toString().

name: key
description: Returns the name of the current branch in the path on the dataSource.

name: set
description: Writes newData to the path this dataSource was constructed with.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} Resolves when write to server is complete.

params.name: newData
params.description: Data to write to dataSource.

return.description: Resolves when write to server is complete.

name: remove
description: Removes the object and all underlying children that this dataSource points to.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} resolves when it has been successfully removed

return.description: resolves when it has been successfully removed

name: push
description:
Writes newData to the path this dataSource was constructed with, appended by a random UID generated by
the dataSource.

params.name: newData
params.description: New data to append to dataSource.

name: setWithPriority
description: Writes newData with given priority (ordering) to the path this dataSource was constructed with.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} Resolves when write to server is complete.

params.name: newData
params.description: New data to set.

params.name: priority
params.description: Priority value by which the data should be ordered.

return.description: Resolves when write to server is complete.

name: setPriority
description: Sets the priority (ordering) of an object on a given dataSource.

params.name: newPriority
params.description: New priority value to order data by.

name: orderByChild
description: Orders the DataSource's childs by the value in child[key].

params.name: childKey
params.description: Key of the field to order by.

name: orderByKey
description: Orders the DataSource's childs by their key names, ignoring their priority.

name: orderByValue
description: Orders the DataSource's childs by their values, ignoring their priority.

name: limitToFirst
description: Returns a new dataSource reference that will limit the subscription to only the first given amount items.

params.name: amount
params.description: Amount of items to limit the dataSource to.

name: limitToLast
description: Returns a new dataSource reference that will limit the subscription to only the last given amount items.

params.name: amount
params.description: Amount of items to limit the dataSource to.

name: authWithOAuthToken
description: Authenticates all instances of this DataSource with the given OAuth provider and credentials.

params.name: provider
params.description: google, facebook, github, or twitter

params.name: credentials
params.description: Access token string, or object with key/value pairs with e.g. OAuth 1.1 credentials.

params.name: onComplete
params.description:
Callback, executed when login is completed either successfully or erroneously.
On error, first argument is error message.
On success, the first argument is null, and the second argument is an object containing the fields uid, provider, auth, and expires.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional, additional client arguments, such as configuring session persistence.

name: linkCurrentUserWithProvider
description: Merges the current user with the specified provider.

name: createProviderFromCredential
description: Creates a provider with the specified type

params.name: providerType
params.description: Can be 'password' or 'facebook'

params.name: credential
params.description:
if 'password' providerType, then an object {email:String,password:String}. If
'facebook' providerType, then a string containing the API token.

name: authWithCustomToken
description: Authenticates all instances of this DataSource with a custom auth token or secret.

params.name: authToken
params.description: Authentication token or secret.

params.name: onComplete
params.description:
Callback, executed when login is completed either successfully or erroneously.
On error, first argument is error message.
On success, the first argument is null, and the second argument is an object containing the fields uid, provider, auth, and expires.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional, additional client arguments, such as configuring session persistence.

name: authWithPassword
description: Authenticates all instances of this DataSource with the given email/password credentials.

params.name: credentials
params.description: Object with key/value pairs {email: "value", password:"value"}.

params.name: onComplete
params.description:
Callback, executed when login is completed either successfully or erroneously.
On error, first argument is error message.
On success, the first argument is null, and the second argument is an object containing the fields uid, provider, auth, and expires.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional, additional client arguments, such as configuring session persistence.

name: registerWithPassword
description: Registers a user with instances of this DataSource with the given email/password credentials.

params.name: credentials
params.description: Object with key/value pairs {email: "value", password:"value"}.

params.name: onComplete
params.description:
Callback, executed when login is completed either successfully or erroneously.
On error, first argument is error message.
On success, the first argument is null, and the second argument is an object containing the fields uid, provider, auth, and expires.

name: authAnonymously
description: Authenticates all instances of this DataSource as an anonymous user.

params.name: onComplete
params.description:
Callback, executed when login is completed either successfully or erroneously.
On error, first argument is error message.
On success, the first argument is null, and the second argument is an object containing the fields uid, provider, auth, and expires.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional, additional client arguments, such as configuring session persistence.

name: getAuth
description:
Fetches the current user's authentication state.
If the user is authenticated, returns an object containing at least the fields uid, provider, auth, and expires.
If the user is not authenticated, returns null.

name: unauth
description: Logs out from the datasource, allowing to re-authenticate at a later time.

name: on
description: Subscribe to an event emitted by the DataSource.

params.name: event
params.description: Event type to subscribe to. Allowed values are: 'value', 'child_changed', 'child_added', 'child_removed', 'child_moved'.

params.name: handler
params.description: Function to call when the subscribed event is emitted.

params.name: context
params.description: Context to set 'this' to when calling the handler function.

name: once
description: Subscribe to an event emitted by the DataSource once, and then immediately unsubscribe.

params.name: event
params.description: Event type to subscribe to. Allowed values are: 'value', 'child_changed', 'child_added', 'child_removed', 'child_moved'.

params.name: handler
params.description: Function to call when the subscribed event is emitted.

params.name: context
params.description: Context to set 'this' to when calling the handler function.

name: off
description:
Unsubscribe to a previously subscribed event. If no handler or context is given, all handlers for
the given event are removed. If no parameters are given at all, all event types will have their handlers removed.

params.name: event
params.description: Event type to unsubscribe from. Allowed values are: 'value', 'child_changed', 'child_added', 'child_removed', 'child_moved'.

params.name: handler
params.description: Optional: Function that was used in previous subscription.

name: setValueChangedCallback
description: Sets the callback triggered when dataSource updates the data.

params.name: callback
params.description: Callback function to call when the subscribed data value changes.

name: update
description: Sets data at the specified path(s) without touching unspecified paths

params.name: data
params.description: The object to push

name: removeValueChangedCallback

The change listener is active by default, so you'll only need to call this method if you've previously called disableChangeListener().

name: bindings
description: Describes a set of decorators used for layouting of a renderable in a View.

name: dynamic
description: Function used to show things in a dynamic manner, depending on the options passed.

name: Layout
description: Describes a set of decorators used for layouting of a renderable in a View.

name: renderable
description:
Merely marks a view property as a decorated renderable, which allows it to be rendered.
Use this in combination with a @layout.custom decorator on the view in which this renderable resides.
examples:
@layout.renderable()
renderable = Surface.with();

name: fullSize
description: Marks the renderable to cover the entire screen. Translate can also be specified on such a renderable.

name: dockSpace
description:
Specifies the space that should come before the docked renderable. Useful when not specifying the size in the
layout.dock function. Note that the space does not appear if there isn't any renderable with a size greater than
zero before it. Can also be specified for the view

params.name: space
params.description: The space that is inserted before the renderable.

dock left or right will be width, whereas dock top or bottom will result in height. For more information about

. The size of the renderable in the one dimension that is being docked, e.g.

filledRenderable = Surface.with({properties: {backgroundColor: 'red'}});

name: draggable
description:
Makes the renderable allowed to be dragged around. this.renderables[name] refers to a RenderNode containing this
draggable along with the renderable itself.

params.name: draggableOptions
params.description: . Same options that can be passed to a Famous Draggable.

params.name: options.snapX
params.description: grid width for snapping during drag

params.name: options.snapY
params.description: grid height for snapping during drag

params.name: options.xRange
params.description: maxmimum [negative, positive] x displacement from start of drag

params.name: options.yRange
params.description: maxmimum [negative, positive] y displacement from start of drag

params.name: options.scale
params.description: one pixel of input motion translates to this many pixels of output drag motion

params.name: options.projection
params.description:
User should set to Draggable._direction.x or
   Draggable._direction.y to constrain to one axis.

name: swipable
description:
Makes the renderable swipable with physics-like velocity after the dragging is released. Emits event
'thresholdReached' with arguments ('x'|'y', 0|1) when any thresholds have been reached. this.renderables[name]
now refers to a a RenderNode containing a positionModifier along with the renderable itself.

params.name: options.snapX
params.description: Whether to snap to the x axis

params.name: options.snapY
params.description: Whether to snap to the Y axis

params.name: options.enabled
params.description: Whether the swipable should be initially enabled

params.name: options.xThreshold
params.description:
Two values of the thresholds that trigger the thresholdReached event with
argument 'x' and second argument 0 or 1, depending on the direction.
Specify undefined in one of them to disable threshold to that direction.

params.name: options.yThreshold
params.description:
Two values of the thresholds that trigger the thresholdReached event with
argument 'y'  and second argument 0 or 1, depending on the direction.
Specify undefined in one of them to disable threshold to that direction.

name: size
description:
Specifies the size of the renderable. For both of the parameters, sizes can be interpreted as follows:

If specified as a function, then the argument passed is the context size of the specified dimension
(width or height). Note that if an arrow function is used, this scoping cannot be used when inside a
decorator, since the scope will be the global scope.

If true is specified or a tilde with a size (e.g. ~300), then the renderable will be automatically sized.
If a tilde is used to indicate the size, then the size after the tilde will be used when/if the
renderable doesn't have a size, or turn into the actual size if it can be determined. This is useful when wanting
to reduce the flickering of surfaces who's size cannot be determined the first render tick.
Beware that true sizing of surfaces or other raw dom elements (input surfaces, image surfaces, text boxes etc)
often comes with a perfomance penalty and should only be used when necessary.
Also beware that any negative size will be interpreted as a tilde, since ~x = 1 - x

If undefined is specified, then the size of that dimension will equal the entire context size.

If a size between 0 and 1 is specified, then that will be interpreted as a proportion of the context size. For
example if 0.5 is specified, then the size will be half of the context size (the parent's size). Instead of
specifying 1 to cover the entire context size, use undefined instead.

name: rotate
description: Rotates the renderable around any of the three axes (in radians).

params.name: x
params.description: The rotation around the x axis (flips vertically)

params.name: y
params.description: The rotation around the y axis (flips horizontally)

params.name: z
params.description: The rotation around the z axis (rotatesin in the more intuitive sense)

name: rotateFrom
description: Rotates the renderable around any of the three axes (in radians) relatively to the current rotation

params.name: x
params.description: The rotation around the x axis (flips vertically)

params.name: y
params.description: The rotation around the y axis (flips horizontally)

params.name: z
params.description: The rotation around the z axis (rotatesin in the more intuitive sense)

name: opacity
description: Sets the opacity of a renderable.

params.name: opacity
params.description: The opacity, between 0 and 1

name: stick
description: Places the renderable by settings origin/align. If nothing is set, it will default to topleft.

name: origin
description:
Sets the point where the renderable has its anchor from where rotation and translation will be done.
You could consider it as translating the negative of the proportion times its size. The arguments are always
between and including 0 and 1.

params.name: x.
params.description: The x of the origin.

params.name: y.
params.description: The y of the origin.

name: align
description: Translates the renderable by a proportion of the context size.

params.name: x.
params.description: The proportion of the context width that is going to be translated.

params.name: y.
params.description: The proportion of the context height that is going to be translated.

name: translate
description:
Specifies a translation of a renderable. Can be applied to every kind of renderable (docked, fullSize,
and normal). Can also be applied on view level to translate every renderable of that view. The view wide translation defaults
to [0, 0, 10] in order to always increase the z space of every level of the Famous rendering tree.

params.name: x
params.description: Moves the renderable along the x axis.

params.name: y
params.description: Moves the renderable along the y axis.

params.name: z
params.description: Moves the renderable along the z axis.

name: translateFrom
description:
Specifies a relative translation of a renderable. Can be applied to every kind of renderable (docked, fullSize,
and normal).
Can also be applied on view level to translate every renderable of that view. The view wide translation defaults
to [0, 0, 10] in order to always increase the z space of every level of the Famous rendering tree.

params.name: x
params.description: Moves the renderable along the x axis.

params.name: y
params.description: Moves the renderable along the y axis.

params.name: z
params.description: Moves the renderable along the z axis.

name: scale
description: Specifies the scale of a renderable. Can be applied to every kind of renderable.

params.name: x
params.description: Scales the renderable along the x axis.

params.name: y
params.description: Scales the renderable along the y axis.

params.name: z
params.description: Scales the renderable along the z axis.

name: skew
description: Specifies the skew of a renderable. Can be applied to every kind of renderable.

params.name: x
params.description: Skews the renderable along the x axis.

params.name: y
params.description: Skews the renderable along the y axis.

params.name: z
params.description: Skews the renderable along the z axis.

name: animate
description:
Creates an animation to show/hide the renderable. Renderables can be shown by calling
this.showRenderable(renderableName) and hidden using this.hideRenderable(renderableName) or
this.showRenderable(renderableName, false). When a renderable has been shown, it will emit the event 'shown'.

params.name: options
params.description: The same as famous-flex Animation Controller, plus 2 more:

params.name: options.showInitially
params.description: Whether to show the renderable when the view is created. (Default: true).

params.name: options.waitFor
params.description:
If specified, it will wait for the renderable with the specified name to show
before showing the renderable

params.name: options.transition
params.description: Transition options.

params.name: options.animation
params.description: Animation function (default: `AnimationController.Animation.FadedZoom`).

params.name: options.zIndexOffset
params.description: Optional z-index difference between the hiding & showing renderable (default: 0).

params.name: options.keepHiddenViewsInDOMCount
params.description: Keeps views in the DOM after they have been hidden (default: 0).

params.name: options.show
params.description: Show specific options.

params.name: options.show.transition
params.description: Show specific transition options.

params.name: options.show.animation
params.description: Show specific animation function.

params.name: options.hide
params.description: Hide specific options.

params.name: options.hide.transition
params.description: Hide specific transition options.

params.name: options.hide.animation
params.description: Hide specific animation function.

params.name: options.transfer
params.description: Transfer options.

params.name: options.transfer.transition
params.description: Transfer specific transition options.

params.name: options.transfer.zIndex
params.description: Z-index the tranferables are moved on top while animating (default: 10).

params.name: options.transfer.fastResize
params.description: When enabled, scales the renderable i.s.o. resizing when doing the transfer animation (default: true).

params.name: options.transfer.items
params.description: Ids (key/value) pairs (source-id/target-id) of the renderables that should be transferred.

name: flow
description: Makes the view flow by tweening all intermediate stages of a changed attribute of any renderable.

params.name: Options
params.description: to pass as flowOptions to the LayoutController

params.name: flowOptions.transition
params.description: If specified, sets the default transition to use

params.name: flowOptions.reflowOnResize
params.description: Smoothly reflows renderables on resize (only used when flow = true) (default: `true`).

params.name: flowOptions.spring
params.description: Spring options used by nodes when reflowing (default: `{dampingRatio: 0.8, period: 300}`).

params.name: flowOptions.properties
params.description: Properties which should be enabled or disabled for flowing.

params.name: flowOptions.insertSpec
params.description: Size, transform, opacity... to use when inserting new renderables into the scene (default: `{}`).

params.name: flowOptions.removeSpec
params.description: Size, transform, opacity... to use when removing renderables from the scene (default: undefined).

name: scrollable
description:
Makes the view as scrollable. This will put the entire content in a ReflowingScrollView that uses getSize on the
view to determine scrolling size. If the size cannot be determined, you might consider declaring your own
getSize() on the View.

name: nativeScrollable
description: Make content scroll natively powered by the browser.

params.name: options
params.description: Options on how to scroll

params.name: options.scrollY
params.description: Defaults to true

params.name: options.scrollX
params.description: Defaults to false

name: dockPadding
description:
Sets the margins for the docked content. This can be applied both to a child and a class. When in conflict,
the parent will override the child's setting. If the margin is set on a Surface, then CSS padding will be set.
margins can be 1, 2, or 4, parameters, which can be specified as shorthand in the same way
as CSS does it.

name: columnDockPadding
description:
Like @layout.dockPadding, sets the padding between this view and its docked content.
When the screen width plus this padding exceeds maxContentWidth, the padding
is increased, so that the content is never wider than maxContentWidth.

params.name: maxContentWidth
params.description: Maximum width the content should be allowed to be.

params.name: defaultPadding
params.description: A 1-D, 2-D, or 4-D array of padding numbers, just like the padding spec in CSS.

name: custom
description:
Adds a custom layout function to the view.
This decorator works directly on the object so you shouldn't pass any arguments nor use parentheses.

name: _subscribe
description: Internal function used by the event decorators to generalize the idea of on, once, and off.

params.name: subscriptionType
params.description: A type of subscription function, e.g. on

params.name: eventName
params.description: The event name

params.name: callback
params.description: that is called when event has happened

name: on
description: Adds an event listener to the renderable when specific event happened.

name: once
description: Adds an event listener to the renderable when specific event happened once.

name: pipe
description:
Pipes events from one renderable to another. The other renderable has to be declared above the one that is doing
the piping, otherwise an exception will be thrown.

name: defaultOptions
description:
Sets the default flow options for a View. These options will be overridden by
each of its renderables, if they have flow options defined through e.g. flow.stateStep()

params.name: flowOptions
params.description: Options to set as default.

params.name: flowOptions.delay
params.description: The amount of milliseconds to wait in between state transitions.

params.name: flowOptions.transition
params.description: A Famo.us-compatible transition object defining the animation specifics.

params.name: flowOptions.transition.curve
params.description: The animation curve to use when flowing from one state to another, e.g. Easing.outCubic.

params.name: flowOptions.transition.duration
params.description: The amount of milliseconds a flow animation should take.

name: defaultState
description:
Functions the same as @flow.stateStep(), and additionally also immediately applies the decorators passed into the 'transformations' argument.
Used to define a state step, without having to also manually apply the same decorators to the renderable to ensure it is rendered this way
on initial show.

params.name: stateName
params.description: The state name to assign to this state step.

params.name: stateOptions
params.description: Flow options to use in the state step.

params.name: stateOptions.delay
params.description: The amount of milliseconds to wait in between state transitions.

params.name: stateOptions.transition
params.description: A Famo.us-compatible transition object defining the animation specifics.

params.name: stateOptions.transition.curve
params.description: The animation curve to use when flowing from one state to another, e.g. Easing.outCubic.

params.name: stateOptions.transition.duration
params.description: The amount of milliseconds a flow animation should take.

params.name: transformations
params.description: Decorators to assign to this state, and to apply initially, passed in as regular comma-separated arguments.

name: stateStep
description:
Used to define a state that the renderable is able to flow to. When multiple state steps with the same state name
are defined, flowing into that state will sequentially execute all defined steps with that state name.

params.name: stateName
params.description: The state name to assign to this state step.

params.name: stateOptions
params.description: Flow options to use in the state step.

params.name: stateOptions.delay
params.description: The amount of milliseconds to wait in between state transitions.

params.name: stateOptions.transition
params.description: A Famo.us-compatible transition object defining the animation specifics.

params.name: stateOptions.transition.curve
params.description: The animation curve to use when flowing from one state to another, e.g. Easing.outCubic.

params.name: stateOptions.transition.duration
params.description: The amount of milliseconds a flow animation should take.

params.name: transformations
params.description: Decorators to assign to this state, and to apply initially, passed in as regular comma-separated arguments.

name: viewStates
description:
Defines the View-level states, that exist of concurrently and sequentially executed renderable-level states.
When e.g. View.setViewFlowState('active') is called, the renderable states defined in the view-level state 'active' are executed.

params.name: states
params.description: An object keyed by View-level state names, with values of arrays of objects.

name: multipleStateStep
description: A wrapper around @flow.stateStep, to allow defining multiple steps with the same state name.

params.name: stateName
params.description: State name to assign states to.

params.name: states
params.description:
An array of {stateOptions: [..], transformations: [..]} objects, with stateOptions and transformations
being the same usage as @flow.stateStep().

```JSON
]
```

params.name: debugName

name: recordForRenderable
description: Records the updates that happen in options and models (intended to be called before the construction of that renderable)

description: Records for a specific entry

name: _doPreprocessing
description:
Executes the preprocess function. The preprocess function is treated similarly to that of a renderable,
but it's identified with the symbol OptionObserver.preprocess instead of a string

Different examples of preprocessing situations:
Scenario 1: Construction
A. The preprocessing function is called
B. Getters are detected for the pre-process function
C. this.options isn't set, so nothing more happens

Scenario 2. Setter trigger of a preprocess function
A. After flushing, it is concluded to belong to the preprocess function (and other renderables)
B. The preprocess function is triggered immediately and firstly when flushing change events
C. The preprocess function re-executes the function and getters are triggered again
D. this.options is defined, and it setters will be notified.
E. An inner flush is forced within the flush, and it there might be new renderables needing update now
F. The flush completes and resets the _updatesForNextTick
G. The outer flush continues, and has nothing more to do
H. Since we made changes within a flush, the static OptionObserver loop _flushAllUpdates, will call the flush function once again, but doing nothing

Scenario 3. Recombine options
A. After flushing, it is concluded that the option changes belong to the preprocess function (and other renderables)
B. Continues same as scenario 2.
